scenario: A customer wants to check their current balance
resolution: If you are verified in chat, I can check your balance right here. Otherwise: 1) Dial *#456# (free USSD), 2) Use MyLankaTel app, 3) SMS BAL to 456, 4) Call 1234 and select balance option, 5) Use my.lankatel.lk portal.

scenario: A customer wants to know how much data they have used this month
resolution: Customer can check data usage by: 1) Dial *#789# for data balance, 2) MyLankaTel app shows detailed usage breakdown, 3) SMS DATA to 456, 4) Call 1234 option 3. Usage shows: Total allocated, Used, Remaining, Reset date.

scenario: A customer wants to activate a data package
resolution: If you are verified in chat, I can activate a package for you. Otherwise: 1) Dial *#123# and select from menu, 2) SMS the package code to 456 (e.g., DATA100 for 100MB pack), 3) Use MyLankaTel app > Packages > Activate, 4) Call 1234 for assisted activation. A confirmation SMS is sent after activation.

scenario: A customer wants to pay their monthly bill
resolution: Bill payment options: 1) MyLankaTel app (instant, cards accepted), 2) my.lankatel.lk online portal, 3) Bank branches (major banks island-wide), 4) LankaTel service centers (cash/card), 5) Retail partners (Cargills, Keells), 6) Mobile wallets (eZ Cash, FriMi), 7) Set up auto-debit for automatic payments.

scenario: A customer has lost their SIM card and needs a replacement
resolution: For SIM replacement: 1) Visit any LankaTel service center with NIC. 2) Pay replacement fee (LKR 100). 3) New SIM activated within 2 hours. 4) Same number retained. Required documents: Original NIC, Police complaint (for lost/stolen). Note: Block lost SIM immediately by calling 1234.

scenario: A customer wants to upgrade to a higher data plan
resolution: To upgrade your plan: 1) Call 1234 and request upgrade, 2) Visit MyLankaTel app > My Plan > Upgrade, 3) Visit service center. Upgrades take effect immediately for prepaid, next billing cycle for postpaid. Pro-rated charges may apply. Downgrade requests require 30-day notice.

scenario: A customer reports their internet is not working
resolution: Troubleshooting steps: 1) Check if modem/router lights are normal (power, internet, wifi should be green/steady). 2) Restart modem - unplug for 30 seconds, plug back in. 3) Check if bill is paid (service may be suspended). 4) Test with wired connection to isolate WiFi issues. 5) Check for area outage at my.lankatel.lk/status. If issue persists, call 1235 for technical support.

scenario: A customer complains about slow internet speed
resolution: For slow speed issues: 1) Run speed test at speedtest.lankatel.lk during off-peak hours. 2) Check data usage - speeds reduce after FUP limit. 3) Restart router. 4) Disconnect other devices to test single device speed. 5) Use wired LAN instead of WiFi for accurate test. 6) Check for background downloads/updates. If speed consistently below 80% of plan speed, contact 1235 with speed test results.

scenario: A customer believes they were overcharged on their bill
resolution: For billing disputes: 1) Review itemized bill in MyLankaTel app. 2) Call 1236 (billing support) with bill reference number. 3) Specify disputed charges. 4) Investigation completed within 48 hours. 5) If valid, credit applied to next bill. 6) Request dispute escalation if unsatisfied. Keep complaint reference for follow-up.

scenario: A customer is traveling abroad and needs roaming services
resolution: To activate international roaming: 1) Call 1234 at least 24 hours before travel. 2) SMS IR ON to 456. 3) Activate via MyLankaTel app > Services > Roaming. Requirements: Postpaid - good payment history, Prepaid - minimum LKR 500 balance. Recommended: Purchase roaming pack for savings. Check destination rates at my.lankatel.lk/roaming.

scenario: A potential customer wants to get a new LankaTel connection
resolution: For new connection: 1) Visit any LankaTel service center or retail outlet. 2) Required: NIC (Sri Lankan) or Passport (foreigners), Proof of address (utility bill). 3) Choose prepaid or postpaid plan. 4) Select number from available options. 5) Pay initial charges. 6) SIM activated within 30 minutes. For FTTH fiber, request installation appointment - 3-7 day lead time.

scenario: A customer forgot their MyLankaTel app password
resolution: To reset MyLankaTel password: 1) Open app and tap 'Forgot Password'. 2) Enter registered mobile number. 3) OTP sent via SMS. 4) Enter OTP and set new password. 5) Password must be 8+ characters with letter and number. Alternative: Call 1234 for assisted reset with security verification.

scenario: A customer wants to cancel their LankaTel service
resolution: For service cancellation: 1) Call 1234 or visit service center with NIC. 2) Clear all outstanding dues. 3) Return any rented equipment (router, ONT). 4) 30-day notice required for postpaid. 5) Refund of deposit (if any) within 14 days. 6) Number cannot be retained after cancellation. Consider temporary suspension as alternative.

scenario: A customer is moving to a new address and wants to transfer their connection
resolution: For connection relocation: 1) Call 1234 or visit service center. 2) Provide new address for coverage check. 3) If covered, relocation scheduled within 5-7 days. 4) Relocation fee: LKR 2,000 (urban), LKR 3,500 (rural). 5) Same number and plan retained. 6) Equipment may need replacement based on new location technology.

scenario: A customer wants a technician to call them about an ongoing issue
resolution: To request technical callback: 1) Call 1235 and register callback request. 2) Provide complaint reference if existing issue. 3) Specify preferred callback time. 4) Callbacks scheduled within 4 hours during business hours. 5) After hours requests handled next business day. 6) SMS confirmation sent with expected callback window.

scenario: A customer wants to stop unwanted value-added services
resolution: To deactivate Value Added Services: 1) SMS STOP [service code] to 456. 2) Dial *#100# > VAS Management > Deactivate. 3) Via MyLankaTel app > Services > Active VAS > Deactivate. 4) Call 1234 for assisted deactivation. Note: Some VAS have minimum subscription period. Deactivation effective within 24 hours.

scenario: A customer experiences poor signal/coverage in their area
resolution: For coverage issues: 1) Confirm location details (address, floor, indoor/outdoor). 2) Check if issue is device-specific (test another device). 3) Try network selection: Settings > Mobile Network > Auto select. 4) Report via MyLankaTel app > Report Issue > Coverage. 5) Call 1235 with location details. 6) Field survey may be scheduled for persistent issues.

scenario: A customer needs help setting up their phone with LankaTel services
resolution: For device setup: 1) Insert LankaTel SIM in device. 2) Power on and wait for network registration. 3) APN auto-configured for most devices. 4) Manual APN if needed: APN=lankatel, Username/Password=blank. 5) For iPhones, carrier settings update may be required. 6) Call 1235 for device-specific assistance.

scenario: A customer wants to transfer their connection to another person
resolution: For ownership transfer: 1) Both parties must visit service center with NICs. 2) Current owner signs transfer authorization. 3) New owner completes registration form. 4) Clear all outstanding dues. 5) Transfer fee: LKR 500. 6) Processing time: 24-48 hours. 7) New owner assumes all contract obligations.

scenario: A customer has an urgent service outage affecting their business
resolution: For emergency/urgent issues: 1) Call 1234 and mention 'urgent business impact'. 2) Enterprise customers: Call dedicated line 1237. 3) Request priority escalation. 4) Provide callback number and stay available. 5) For complete outages, check my.lankatel.lk/status for area-wide issues. 6) SLA: Critical issues acknowledged within 30 minutes, resolved within 4 hours.

scenario: A customer wants to recharge their prepaid account
resolution: Prepaid recharge options: 1) MyLankaTel app - instant recharge with cards or wallets, 2) Dial *#123# and select recharge, 3) Visit service center or retail partner (Cargills, Keells), 4) Bank branches, 5) Mobile wallets (eZ Cash, FriMi, LankaTel Pay). Minimum recharge: LKR 20. Bonus: Recharge LKR 500+ via app gets 5% extra bonus data. Recharge valid for 365 days from last usage.

scenario: A customer needs to download their bill for expense claims
resolution: To download bill: 1) MyLankaTel app > Billing > View Bills > Download PDF, 2) my.lankatel.lk > Billing History > Download, 3) Email request to billing@lankatel.lk with account number, 4) Visit service center for printed copy (LKR 100 fee). Bills available for last 24 months. PDF format includes VAT breakdown suitable for expense claims. Email delivery available from app.

scenario: A customer's data package expired and they want to know what happened
resolution: Package expiry explanation: 1) Check package validity in MyLankaTel app > Active Packages, 2) Packages expire at end of validity period (7, 15, or 30 days), 3) After expiry, service reverts to base rates (LKR 15 per 100MB), 4) Activate new package via *#123# or app to continue service, 5) Enable auto-renewal in app to prevent expiry. SMS alerts sent 1 day before expiry. Expired packages cannot be extended.

scenario: A postpaid customer reached their credit limit and service is restricted
resolution: Credit limit reached: 1) Check current usage in MyLankaTel app > Account > Credit Limit, 2) Pay outstanding bill to restore service, 3) Request credit limit increase: Call 1234 (requires 6+ months good payment history), 4) Temporary limit increase available for emergencies (valid 1 month), 5) Service restrictions: Outgoing calls barred, data speed reduced, SMS limited. Clear bill to restore full service immediately.

scenario: A customer wants to set up automatic bill payment
resolution: Auto-pay setup: 1) MyLankaTel app > Billing > Auto-Pay Settings, 2) Select payment method (card or bank account), 3) Enter payment details and authorize, 4) Set payment date (due date or 3 days before), 5) Confirm setup. Benefits: Never miss payment, avoid LKR 150 late fee, automatic processing. SMS alert sent 2 days before auto-debit. Can modify or cancel anytime via app. Supported banks: BOC, Peoples, Commercial, Sampath, HNB, NDB, Seylan.

scenario: A customer wants to make international calls and needs to know rates
resolution: International calling: 1) Check rates at my.lankatel.lk/roaming or app, 2) Standard rates: India LKR 25/min, UAE LKR 35/min, UK/USA LKR 50/min, 3) Save money: Activate IDD package via *#130# (SAARC 100 mins for LKR 500, Global 30 mins for LKR 750), 4) Packages valid 30 days, 5) Use Wi-Fi calling via app for free (uses data). Best rates: Purchase country-specific packages before calling.

scenario: A customer wants to pay their device installment separately
resolution: Device installment payment: 1) Installment included in monthly bill automatically, 2) Pay full bill to cover installment, 3) Early settlement: Visit service center, pay remaining balance (no penalty), 4) Check remaining installments in app > Devices > Installment Details, 5) Default: 2 missed payments = device blocked, full balance due. Installment amount shown separately on bill. Contact 1234 for installment queries.

scenario: A customer wants to add a family member to their family plan
resolution: Add family member: 1) MyLankaTel app > Family Plans > Add Member, 2) Enter family member's LankaTel number, 3) Send invitation (member receives SMS), 4) Member accepts invitation, 5) Member added to shared data pool. Maximum 5 members per family plan. Primary account holder manages all members. Consolidated bill sent to primary holder. Members can view own usage but cannot modify plan.

scenario: A customer lost their phone and needs to protect their account
resolution: Lost phone steps: 1) Immediately call 1234 to freeze account (prevents unauthorized use), 2) Access MyLankaTel web portal from any device > Security > Freeze Account, 3) File police report within 24 hours (for insurance), 4) Visit service center with NIC and police report for SIM replacement (LKR 300), 5) New SIM issued with same number within 30 minutes, 6) Review account activity for unauthorized usage. Account freeze is free and immediate.

scenario: A student wants to verify their status for student discounts
resolution: Student verification: 1) Visit service center with student ID, admission letter, and NIC, 2) Age requirement: 16-25 years, 3) Verification processing: 24-48 hours, 4) Student benefits: Special packages (30GB for LKR 600, 50GB for LKR 900), free educational app data, 15% device discount, 5) Validity: 1 academic year, requires annual reverification. Available at major universities: Colombo, Peradeniya, SLIIT, NSBM. Online verification launching soon.

scenario: A senior citizen wants to apply for senior discounts
resolution: Senior citizen benefits: 1) Visit service center with NIC (age 60+), 2) Immediate verification upon document check, 3) Benefits: 20% discount on voice packages, priority customer care, free home installation (normally LKR 1,500), special senior plans (Basic Talk LKR 400/month, Standard Talk LKR 800/month), 4) Lifetime validity once verified, 5) Family Connect feature available. No expiry on senior status.

scenario: A customer wants to switch to paperless e-billing
resolution: Paperless enrollment: 1) MyLankaTel app > Billing > Go Paperless, 2) Verify email via OTP, 3) Benefits: Bills 3 days earlier, 24-month archive, instant download, LKR 50 welcome credit, monthly 500MB bonus data, 4) Bills delivered via email (PDF), SMS (link), app notification, 5) Can request paper bill for specific months if needed, 6) Revert to paper requires 30-day notice. Over 60% of customers now paperless.

scenario: A customer wants to set up alerts for data usage
resolution: Usage alerts setup: 1) MyLankaTel app > Usage > Configure Alerts, 2) Set alert thresholds (50%, 75%, 90%, 100%), 3) Choose notification method (SMS, email, push), 4) Set quiet hours if needed, 5) Alerts sent automatically when thresholds reached. Also available: Voice minute alerts, SMS alerts, bill amount alerts, roaming alerts. Real-time usage dashboard shows current consumption. Export usage reports available.

scenario: A customer wants to port their number from another operator to LankaTel
resolution: Number porting to LankaTel: 1) SMS 'PORT [your number]' to 1234 from current number, 2) Receive UPC (Unique Porting Code) valid 15 days, 3) Visit LankaTel service center with NIC and UPC, 4) Choose LankaTel plan, pay LKR 500 porting fee, 5) Porting completes in 3-5 business days, 6) Insert new LankaTel SIM when notified. Requirements: Number active 90+ days, no outstanding dues with current operator, account in your name. Keep old SIM for 7 days.

scenario: A customer wants to gift data to a friend or family member
resolution: Gift data: 1) MyLankaTel app > Gift Data, 2) Enter recipient's LankaTel number, 3) Choose amount: 500MB (LKR 25), 1GB (LKR 45), 2GB (LKR 85), 5GB (LKR 200), 10GB (LKR 380), 4) Add optional message, 5) Complete payment. Recipient receives SMS, data credited immediately. USSD: *#131*[number]*[code]#. Limits: Max 10GB per transaction, 50GB per month. Gifted data valid 7 days. Postpaid: charged to next bill. Prepaid: deducted from balance.

scenario: A customer wants to temporarily freeze their account for security
resolution: Account freeze: 1) Call 1234 (24/7) request emergency freeze, 2) MyLankaTel app > Security > Freeze Account (requires PIN/biometric), 3) Effects: All outgoing blocked, incoming works, emergency calls (119, 118) always available, no charges during freeze, 4) Unfreeze: Call 1234 with security verification or app with biometric, 5) Review activity log before unfreezing. Use when: SIM lost/stolen, suspicious activity, traveling abroad. No penalty for false alarms.

scenario: A customer wants to know their VIP tier status and benefits
resolution: VIP tier check: 1) MyLankaTel app > Profile > Membership Tier, 2) Tiers: Silver (LKR 3,000+ monthly for 6 months) - 5% discount, priority support, Gold (LKR 7,000+ monthly for 6 months) - 10% discount, airport lounge access, Platinum (LKR 15,000+ monthly for 12 months) - 15% discount, unlimited lounge, concierge service, 3) Benefits automatic upon qualification, 4) Tier reviewed quarterly, 5) Must maintain spend to retain tier. Additional benefits: Faster service, waived late fee once/year, higher credit limits.

scenario: A customer wants to know about unused data rollover
resolution: Data rollover: 1) Available for monthly packages 10GB+, 2) Unused data carries to next month (max 50% of package), 3) Rolled data expires end of following month, 4) View rollover balance in app > Data > Rollover Balance, 5) Must activate same or higher package for rollover, 6) Not eligible: Daily/weekly packages, promotional packages, time-based packages. Example: 20GB package, used 15GB = 5GB rolls over. Rolled data used after fresh data.

scenario: A customer needs to file a device insurance claim
resolution: Insurance claim: 1) Report incident within 48 hours via 1234, 2) For theft: Submit police report copy, 3) Device assessment at authorized centers (Colombo Fort, Kandy, Galle), 4) Premium tiers: Basic LKR 350/month (up to Rs. 50,000), Mid LKR 650/month (Rs. 50,000-100,000), Premium LKR 950/month (Rs. 100,000-200,000), 5) Coverage: Screen damage, liquid, theft, accidental, hardware malfunction, 6) Claims: Max 2 per year, excess LKR 2,500 per claim, 7) Repair/replacement within 7-10 business days.

scenario: A customer's payment failed and they need to retry
resolution: Payment failure: 1) Check error message in app, 2) Common causes: Insufficient funds, card declined, network issues, expired card, 3) Retry: Update payment method if needed, ensure sufficient balance, try different payment method, 4) Failed auto-pay fee: LKR 500 (waived for manual retries), 5) Contact 1234 if issue persists, 6) Alternative: Pay via bank transfer, service center, or retail partner. Payment confirmation SMS sent within 5 minutes of success. Check payment history in app.

scenario: A customer moved and needs to update their address
resolution: Address update: 1) Visit service center with NIC and proof of new address (utility bill, bank statement not older than 3 months), 2) Cannot be done online for security, 3) Update processed immediately, 4) For fixed connection relocation: Separate relocation process required (fee LKR 2,000-3,500), 5) Address change free of charge, 6) Important for: Bill delivery, service center location, coverage verification. Update email and phone can be done via app with OTP verification.

scenario: A customer wants to redeem their loyalty points
resolution: Loyalty redemption: 1) MyLankaTel app > Rewards > Browse Catalog, 2) Redemption options: Data packages (500 points = 1GB), Voice minutes (300 points = 100 mins), Bill discount (1000 points = LKR 100 off), Accessories (earbuds, chargers, cases), Premium services (lounge passes, insurance vouchers), 3) Points value: 1000 points â‰ˆ LKR 100, 4) Instant credit for digital items, 5) Physical items delivered in 3-5 days, 6) Points valid 12 months, any activity extends validity. Earn 10 points per LKR 100 spent.

scenario: A customer wants to create a shared data pool for family
resolution: Shared data pool: 1) MyLankaTel app > Family Plans > Create Pool (postpaid only), 2) Add members by LankaTel number, send invitations, 3) Pool options: 50GB (LKR 3,000/month), 100GB (LKR 5,000/month), 200GB (LKR 8,500/month), 500GB (LKR 18,000/month), 4) Max 10 members per pool, 5) Data shared in real-time, 6) Primary holder gets alerts at 75% and 90%, 7) 30-40% savings vs individual plans, 8) Members can opt out anytime. Individual usage visible in dashboard.

scenario: A customer needs an account statement for tax purposes
resolution: Account statement: 1) Download from app or website (last 24 months free), 2) Formats: PDF (for records), Excel (for analysis), 3) Email request to billing@lankatel.lk for older records (3-5 days processing), 4) Service center printout: LKR 100 per copy, 5) Statement includes: Call logs, data usage, SMS count, payments, adjustments, 6) For businesses: VAT breakdown, tax certificates available, 7) Statements retained 7 years per regulations. Export statements anytime from app.

scenario: A customer wants to temporarily suspend service while traveling
resolution: Temporary suspension: 1) Call 1234 or visit service center, 2) Duration: Minimum 1 month, maximum 6 months, 3) Fee: LKR 200/month (keeps number reserved), 4) No usage charges during suspension, 5) Service auto-reactivates on end date, 6) Manual reactivation: Call 1234 anytime, 7) Same number and plan restored, 8) Good for: Extended travel, temporary relocation. Cannot suspend if device installment active. Suspension fee added to next bill.

scenario: A postpaid customer wants to increase their credit limit
resolution: Credit limit increase: 1) Eligibility: Account active 6+ months, good payment history (no defaults in 6 months), 2) Call 1236 billing hotline or visit service center, 3) Provide proof of income: Salary slip, bank statement (3 months), business income proof, 4) Credit evaluation: 3-5 business days, 5) Current limits: Standard LKR 5,000, Silver LKR 10,000, Gold LKR 25,000, Platinum LKR 50,000, 6) Increase: Up to 50% of current limit based on assessment, 7) Temporary increase available for emergencies (1 month). Approved increases effective within 24 hours.

scenario: A customer wants to refer a friend and earn rewards
resolution: Referral program: 1) Get referral code from MyLankaTel app > Referrals, 2) Share code via SMS, WhatsApp, email, social media, 3) Friend registers new LankaTel connection using code, 4) Rewards: 500 loyalty points per successful referral, LKR 100 account credit after 30 days, bonus 200 points if friend activates postpaid, 5) Friend gets: LKR 50 welcome credit, waived SIM fee (LKR 300 value), 1GB free data, 6) Max 20 referrals per year, 7) Both must stay active 30 days. Points credited within 48 hours.

scenario: A customer wants to enable 2FA for account security
resolution: 2FA setup: 1) MyLankaTel app > Settings > Security > Enable 2FA, 2) Choose method: SMS OTP (to registered number) or Authenticator app (Google Authenticator, Authy), 3) For SMS: OTP sent for each new device login, 4) For Authenticator: Scan QR code, enter 6-digit code to verify, 5) Save backup codes securely, 6) 2FA required for: New device login, transactions over LKR 5,000, account changes, SIM replacement, 7) Disable: Security settings with current authentication. Highly recommended for postpaid accounts.

scenario: A customer wants to trade in their old phone for credit
resolution: Device trade-in: 1) Visit authorized LankaTel store (Colombo Fort, Kandy, Galle, Negombo), 2) Device inspection: Screen condition, functionality, battery health, damage assessment, 3) Valuation: Excellent (70-80% value), Good (50-65%), Fair (30-45%), Poor (10-25%), 4) Credit applied immediately to new device purchase, 5) Requirements: Device powers on, no iCloud/Google lock, factory reset completed, 6) Credit valid 90 days, 7) Can use for: New device, account credit, accessories. Example: iPhone 11 Pro excellent condition = LKR 75,000-95,000 credit.

scenario: A customer's complaint was not resolved and wants to escalate
resolution: Complaint escalation: Level 1 - Call 1234, get ticket number (24-48 hour resolution), Level 2 - Request supervisor, email complaints@lankatel.lk with ticket (3-5 days), Level 3 - Call 1234 request CRM transfer, email crm@lankatel.lk (5-7 days), Level 4 - Email customercare@lankatel.lk marked 'ESCALATION' (7-10 days), External - TRC at trc.gov.lk (after all internal exhausted). Keep all ticket numbers, emails, screenshots. Most resolved by Level 2. TRC escalation rare (<1%).

scenario: A customer wants to manage multiple devices on one account
resolution: Multi-device management: 1) MyLankaTel app > Devices > Add New Device, 2) Enter IMEI or scan barcode, 3) Assign nickname (e.g., 'Work Laptop'), 4) Max 5 devices per account, 5) Features: View usage per device, set individual limits, remotely enable/disable data, track location (with consent), 6) Data models: Shared pool or individual allocation, 7) eSIM support: QR code provisioning via app, 8) Wearable support: NumberShare for smartwatches, 9) Corporate: IT admin can manage employee devices. Remove devices anytime.

scenario: A prepaid customer wants to convert to postpaid
resolution: Prepaid to postpaid: 1) Call 1234 or visit service center, 2) Requirements: Proof of income (salary slip, bank statement), proof of address, 3) Credit evaluation: 24-48 hours, 4) Same number retained, 5) Remaining prepaid balance: Forfeited or credited to first bill (your choice), 6) Postpaid benefits: No recharge needed, higher credit limit (LKR 5,000+), device financing eligibility, 7) Security deposit may apply (LKR 2,000-5,000), 8) Processing: 24-48 hours. Service continues during conversion.

scenario: A postpaid customer wants to convert to prepaid
resolution: Postpaid to prepaid: 1) Call 1234 or visit service center, 2) Clear all outstanding dues (mandatory), 3) Complete final billing cycle, 4) Same number retained, 5) Processing: 24-48 hours, 6) Initial recharge required: Minimum LKR 100, 7) Contract obligations: Must fulfill or pay early termination fee, 8) Device installments: Must clear or continue paying separately, 9) Benefits: Pay-as-you-go, no monthly commitment, control spending. Conversion effective from next billing cycle.

scenario: A customer wants to check their account activity for security
resolution: Activity log: 1) MyLankaTel app > Security > Activity Log, 2) Shows: Login history (date, time, device, location, IP), password changes, profile updates, package activations, SIM changes, payments, settings changes, 3) Suspicious activity flags: Unknown location login, multiple failed attempts, unauthorized changes, 4) Security alerts: Email for new device login, password change, high-value transactions (LKR 5,000+), 5) Export: Download 90-day history as PDF/Excel, 6) Review weekly for personal, daily for corporate. If suspicious: Change password, enable 2FA, call 1234, freeze account.

scenario: A customer wants to estimate their upcoming bill
resolution: Bill estimation: 1) MyLankaTel app > Billing > Bill Estimate, 2) Shows projected bill based on: Current usage patterns, active packages, recurring charges, estimated excess usage, 3) Real-time updates as usage changes, 4) Comparison with previous bills, 5) Usage forecasting: Predict data/voice/SMS needs, 6) Cost optimization: Recommendations for package changes, 7) Bill alerts: Set amount thresholds, notifications when approaching budget, 8) Corporate: Department-wise estimates, budget planning tools. Estimation updates daily based on actual usage.

scenario: A customer wants to view their payment history
resolution: Payment history: 1) MyLankaTel app > Payment History, 2) Shows: Date/time, amount, payment method, transaction reference, bill period, status (successful/pending/failed), 3) Filter by: Date range, payment method, amount, 4) Export: Download as PDF or Excel, email history, print records, 5) Last 24 months available online, 6) Payment receipts: Download individual receipts, view details, print, save digitally, 7) Track: Payment status, pending payments, processing, verify completion. Corporate: Bulk payment history, department-wise payments.

scenario: A customer needs to find the nearest service center
resolution: Service center locator: 1) MyLankaTel app > Service Centers, 2) Interactive map with all locations, 3) Search by area or address, 4) Filter by services available, 5) View: Address, phone, hours, services, queue status, 6) Book appointment: Select service type, choose time slot, receive confirmation, 7) Major locations: Colombo Fort (flagship), Kandy City Center, Galle, Negombo, Jaffna, Kurunegala, Matara, 8) Hours: Mon-Fri 9 AM-6 PM, Sat 9 AM-2 PM, closed Sundays, 9) VIP services: Dedicated counters, priority service, lounges at major centers. Over 50 locations nationwide.

scenario: A customer cannot access their account after long inactivity
resolution: Account recovery: 1) Account status: Inactive 90 days = suspended, 6 months = dormant, 2) Recovery: Call 1234 or visit service center with NIC, 3) Verification: Identity confirmation, address verification, security questions, 4) Outstanding balance: Must clear any dues from inactive period, 5) Reactivation fee: LKR 500 if inactive over 6 months, 6) Number recovery: If available, same number restored. If released, new number assigned, 7) Timeline: Immediate if number available, 24-48 hours if new number, 8) Prevention: Maintain activity (one call/SMS every 90 days). Plan may need to be updated if old plan unavailable.

scenario: A business customer wants information about corporate services
resolution: Corporate services: 1) Contact: Call 1237 or email enterprise@lankatel.lk, 2) Services: Bulk SIM activation (min 10 connections), consolidated billing, custom billing cycles, department allocation, usage reports, API integration, 3) Plans: Basic (5GB - LKR 800/month), Standard (15GB - LKR 1,500/month), Premium (50GB - LKR 2,800/month), Unlimited (LKR 4,500/month), 4) Volume discounts: 10-25 SIMs (10% off), 26-50 (15% off), 51-100 (20% off), 100+ (25% off), 5) Dedicated account manager, 6) Processing: 3-5 business days. Popular among Colombo businesses, BPOs in Kandy.

scenario: A customer wants to check if there's a network outage in their area
resolution: Network status check: 1) my.lankatel.lk/status or app > Network Status, 2) Shows: Current network status, planned maintenance, known outages, service restoration times, 3) Report issue: App > Report Issue > Network Problem, 4) Check coverage: App > Coverage Map, enter address, 5) Signal strength: App shows real-time signal indicator, 6) Maintenance schedule: View upcoming maintenance windows, 7) Status updates: Real-time updates every 5 minutes, push notifications for changes, 8) If outage: Estimated restoration time shown, alternative service options, emergency contact information. Most issues resolved within 4 hours.

scenario: A customer wants to change their billing cycle date
resolution: Billing cycle change: 1) Request via 1234 or service center, 2) Provide reason (align with salary, business cycle), 3) Options: Mid-month (15th), End-month, Custom date (subject to approval), 4) Approval: 24-48 hours, 5) New cycle effective from next billing period, 6) First bill may be pro-rated, 7) Cannot change more than once per year, 8) Due date automatically calculated (15 days after bill generation). Corporate accounts: Flexible cycles, multiple cycles for departments.

scenario: A customer received high bill due to excess usage charges
resolution: Excess usage charges: 1) Rates: Data LKR 15 per 100MB, Voice (any network) LKR 2/min, Voice (LankaTel) LKR 1/min, SMS LKR 0.50 each, 2) Check usage in app to see what exceeded, 3) Prevention: Set usage alerts (80%, 90%, 100%), activate add-on boosters before exhausting package, enable data limit in phone settings, 4) Solution: Upgrade to higher package if regularly exceeding, 5) One-time credit may be available for first-time excess (contact 1236), 6) Monitor usage regularly to avoid surprises. Excess charges shown separately on bill.

scenario: A customer returned from travel and has high roaming charges
resolution: Roaming charges: 1) Check roaming usage in app > International > Roaming History, 2) Rates vary by country: Zone A (India, Singapore) - Data LKR 15/MB, Calls LKR 20/min, Zone B (UK, UAE) - Data LKR 25/MB, Calls LKR 35/min, Zone C (USA, Europe) - Data LKR 35/MB, Calls LKR 50/min, 3) Save money: Purchase roaming packs before travel (1GB + 30 mins Zone A = LKR 999), 4) Dispute: Contact 1236 within 30 days with travel dates, 5) Future: Activate roaming packs before travel, use Wi-Fi when available, disable data roaming when not needed. Incoming calls while roaming: Half of outgoing rate.

scenario: A customer noticed unwanted VAS charges on their bill
resolution: Unauthorized VAS: 1) Review active VAS in app > Services > Active VAS, 2) Deactivate immediately: SMS STOP [service code] to 456, or app, or call 1234, 3) Dispute charge: Call 1236 with bill reference, request refund if unauthorized, 4) Investigation: 48 hours, credit applied if valid, 5) Prevention: Set VAS blocking in app settings, require PIN for VAS activation, 6) Common VAS: Caller tunes (LKR 50/month), voicemail (LKR 100/month), call waiting (LKR 50/month). Check bill monthly for unexpected charges.

scenario: A customer wants to buy a phone on installment
resolution: Device financing: 1) Eligibility: Postpaid customer, 6+ months tenure, good payment history, 2) Visit LankaTel retail outlet or service center, 3) Choose device: iPhone, Samsung, Xiaomi, Huawei available, 4) Down payment: 20-30% of device price, 5) Tenure: 12 or 24 months, 6) Interest: 0% for promotional devices, otherwise 12% flat, 7) Monthly installment added to bill, 8) Early settlement: Pay remaining balance anytime (no penalty), 9) Default: 2 missed payments = device blocked, full balance due. Popular devices: iPhone 14, Samsung Galaxy S23, Xiaomi 13.

scenario: A customer forgot their account PIN and needs to reset it
resolution: PIN reset: 1) PIN required for: Plan changes, number porting, SIM replacement, account closure, 2) Reset: Visit service center with original NIC only (cannot reset via phone/app for security), 3) No fee for PIN reset, 4) New PIN: 4-digit number, choose memorable but secure, 5) Security: Three wrong attempts locks account (call 1234 to unlock), 6) Keep PIN confidential - LankaTel never asks for full PIN, 7) If account locked: Call 1234 with security verification to unlock. PIN protects account from unauthorized changes.

scenario: A family member needs to handle account of deceased account holder
resolution: Deceased account holder: 1) Legal heir visits service center with: Death certificate (original), NIC of deceased, Legal heir NIC, Letter of administration/probate (if applicable), 2) Options: Transfer account to heir, Cancel service, 3) Outstanding dues: Settled from estate, 4) Deposit refund: To legal heir, 5) Processing: 7-14 business days, 6) Contact 1234 for guidance on required documents, 7) Service continues until transfer/cancellation processed, 8) Number can be transferred to heir if desired. All documents must be original or certified copies.

scenario: A customer wants to relocate their fixed connection and wants to know costs
resolution: Connection relocation: 1) Check coverage at new address first (call 1234), 2) Relocation fees: Colombo/Gampaha LKR 2,000, Outstation LKR 3,500, 3) Process: Call 1234 or visit service center, provide new address, preferred installation date, 4) Timeline: 5-7 business days, 5) Same number and plan retained, 6) Equipment: May change based on new location technology (ONT/router), 7) Cannot relocate between districts, 8) Payment: Fee added to next bill or pay upfront. Existing plan continues at new location.

scenario: A postpaid customer wants to add an additional line to their account
resolution: Supplementary line: 1) Primary account holder requests via 1234 or service center, 2) Maximum 5 supplementary lines per account, 3) Each line: Monthly fee + shared or separate data allocation, 4) Billing: Combined to primary account, 5) Primary holder responsible for all charges, 6) Supplementary users: Cannot make account changes, can view own usage, 7) Good for: Family plans, business lines, 8) Activation: 24-48 hours, 9) Cost: Base line fee LKR 500/month + plan charges. All lines share credit limit of primary account.

scenario: A customer wants to cancel service but is in contract period
resolution: Early termination: 1) If cancelling before contract end: Device installment balance due immediately, Early termination fee = Remaining months x monthly commitment fee (typically LKR 500/month), Promotional discounts reversed, 2) Example: 12-month contract, cancel at month 6 = 6 x LKR 500 = LKR 3,000 ETF, 3) Request contract details to understand obligations, 4) Consider: Temporary suspension (LKR 200/month) as alternative, Wait for contract completion, 5) Contact 1234 to calculate exact termination costs. ETF varies based on contract terms and remaining period.

scenario: A customer's prepaid balance expired and they want to know why
resolution: Prepaid balance expiry: 1) Balance validity: 365 days from last recharge or usage, 2) Expiry warnings: SMS at 30 days, 7 days, 1 day before expiry, 3) Before expiry: Make any recharge (min LKR 20) or use any service to extend validity, 4) After expiry: Balance forfeited, cannot be recovered, account becomes inactive, 5) Number may be released after 90 days of inactivity, 6) Prevention: Set up auto-recharge, enable low balance alerts, regular usage keeps balance active, 7) Bonus data expiry: Separate from main balance, valid 7 days only. Check expiry date in app regularly.

scenario: A customer filed a billing dispute and wants to know status
resolution: Dispute status: 1) Check status: Call 1236 with dispute reference number, Check app > Billing > Disputes, 2) Investigation timeline: Standard disputes 48 hours, Complex cases 5-10 business days, 3) During investigation: Pay undisputed portion to avoid service interruption, Disputed amount kept on hold, 4) Resolution: If valid - credit issued, appears on next bill, If invalid - detailed explanation with usage logs provided, 5) Escalation: Request supervisor review if unsatisfied, Email complaints@lankatel.lk with reference, 6) Final escalation: TRC at trc.gov.lk. Keep all documentation: SMS, usage logs, confirmations. Resolution rate: 85% resolved favorably within 10 days.

scenario: A customer is traveling and wants to buy a roaming data pack
resolution: Roaming packs: 1) Purchase before travel via app > International > Roaming Packs, or call 1234, 2) Zone A (India, Singapore, Maldives): 1GB + 30 mins = LKR 999, 3GB + 60 mins = LKR 2,499, 3) Zone B (UK, UAE, Australia): 500MB + 20 mins = LKR 1,499, 2GB + 40 mins = LKR 3,999, 4) Global pack: 2GB + 60 mins = LKR 2,999 (covers 50+ countries), 5) Packs valid 30 days from activation, 6) Usage alerts: SMS at 50%, 80%, 100% of pack, 7) Auto-top-up available if pack exhausted, 8) Much cheaper than pay-as-you-go rates. Activate at least 24 hours before travel.

scenario: A customer's account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts
resolution: Account lockout: 1) Causes: 3 wrong passwords, suspicious activity, 3 wrong PIN attempts, 2) Auto-unlock: Wait 30 minutes for failed login attempts, 3) Immediate unlock: Call 1234 with account verification (NIC, email, security questions), 4) App unlock: Use 'Forgot Password' if locked due to password, 5) Service center: Visit with NIC for immediate manual unlock, 6) After unlock: Review activity log for unauthorized access, Change password immediately if suspicious, Enable 2FA for added security, 7) Prevention: Use biometric login, strong unique password, enable 2FA, never share credentials. Corporate: IT admin can unlock employee accounts.

scenario: A customer wants to test their internet speed
resolution: Speed test: 1) Official test: speedtest.lankatel.lk or app > Speed Test, 2) Best practices: Test during off-peak hours (not 6-10 PM), Use wired connection (not WiFi) for accurate test, Disconnect other devices, Close background apps, 3) Expected speeds: 4G LTE up to 150 Mbps, FTTH up to 1 Gbps, ADSL up to 8 Mbps, 4) If speed below 80% of plan speed: Contact 1235 with test results, Check data usage (speeds reduce after FUP), Restart router/modem, 5) Speed varies by: Location, network congestion, device capability, time of day. Run multiple tests for accuracy.

scenario: A customer forgot their WiFi password and needs to reset it
resolution: WiFi password reset: 1) Access router admin: Connect via LAN cable, Open browser, type 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1, 2) Login: Default username/password on router label (usually admin/admin), 3) Navigate: Wireless Settings > Security > Change password, 4) Alternative: Reset router to factory (button on back, hold 10 seconds), 5) LankaTel router: Call 1235 for assistance, technician can help remotely, 6) New password: Use strong password (8+ characters, mix letters/numbers), 7) Update all devices with new password. Router label shows default credentials if needed.

scenario: A customer wants to forward calls to another number
resolution: Call forwarding: 1) Activate: Dial *21*[target number]# then press call, Example: *21*0771234567#, 2) Deactivate: Dial #21# then press call, 3) Via app: MyLankaTel app > Services > Call Forwarding, 4) VAS charge: LKR 50/month, 5) Types: Forward all calls, Forward when busy, Forward when unanswered, Forward when unreachable, 6) Forward to: Any local number, International numbers (charges apply), 7) Check status: Dial *#21# to see current forwarding settings, 8) Useful for: Business calls, temporary number change, backup phone. Forwarding charges apply per forwarded call.

scenario: A customer wants to set up voicemail service
resolution: Voicemail setup: 1) Activate: Call 1234 request voicemail activation, or app > Services > Voicemail, 2) Cost: LKR 100/month, 3) Setup: Call 1234 and follow prompts to record greeting, 4) Access messages: Dial 1234 and select voicemail option, or app > Voicemail, 5) Notification: SMS alert when new voicemail received, 6) Storage: Up to 20 messages, 7) Features: Custom greeting, message forwarding, message deletion, 8) International: Voicemail works while roaming, 9) Deactivate: Call 1234 or app settings. Voicemail useful for missed calls when unavailable.

scenario: A customer wants to enable caller ID display on their number
resolution: Caller ID: 1) Activate: Call 1234 request caller ID, or app > Services > Caller ID, 2) Cost: LKR 50/month, 3) Feature: Your number displayed to recipients when calling, 4) Works for: All outgoing calls, International calls (if supported by destination), 5) Privacy: Can hide number per call by dialing #31# before number, 6) Business: Useful for business calls, customer recognition, 7) Check status: Dial *#62# to see caller ID settings, 8) Deactivate: Call 1234 or app. Caller ID helps recipients identify your calls.

scenario: A customer wants to manually select network operator
resolution: Network selection: 1) Android: Settings > Mobile Networks > Network Operators > Search Networks > Select LankaTel, 2) iPhone: Settings > Cellular > Network Selection > Turn off Automatic > Select LankaTel, 3) Use when: Poor signal, want to force LankaTel network, troubleshooting, 4) Auto-select: Usually best (finds strongest signal), 5) Manual: Useful if device connecting to wrong network, 6) If LankaTel not listed: Check SIM card inserted correctly, Check coverage in area, Restart device, 7) Contact 1235 if network selection issues persist. Manual selection may reduce battery life.
